Director of the EU Agency for the Cooperation of Energy Regulators

The EU Agency for the Cooperation of Energy Regulators (ACER) plays a key role in driving increased energy market integration across Europe to bring secure, sustainable and affordable energy to Europeans. This helps EU competitiveness and energy security.

ACER is an Agency of the European Union. The head of the Agency is called the Director.

ACER is seeking its next Director to head up and run ACER

ACER plays a central role in coordinating the EU’s national energy regulatory authorities, advancing electricity, gas and hydrogen markets, overseeing European energy networks and ensuring regulatory convergence in support of EU energy and decarbonisation goals.

As Director of the Agency, you will provide strategic leadership of the Agency, manage it, guide complex decisions and ensure that it delivers on its expanding mandate.

You will lead a skilled multicultural team in ACER’s headquarters in Ljubljana, Slovenia.

You will collaborate with ACER’s members, the national energy regulators from every EU Member State, and work closely with the EU institutions and many stakeholders to turn Europe's ambitious energy goals into reality. Your integrity, your managerial acumen, your communication skills and strong leadership qualities will be essential.

In this role, you won't just manage an EU Agency and be its public face, you will shape the European energy system at a pivotal moment in its clean energy transition. In ACER, we work across borders and with a shared purpose, namely to shape secure, sustainable and efficient EU energy markets and systems to the benefit of all Europeans.

If this resonates with you, this could be your next career-defining step.

The job of ACER Director is for 5 years, with a possible extension for a further 5 years maximum.

Place of employment: Ljubljana, Slovenia Who can apply?

You must meet the conditions set out in the vacancy notice such as being a national of an EU Member State and having at least 15 years’ postgraduate professional experience.

ACER is an equal opportunities employer. ACER welcomes applications from all qualified candidates from diverse backgrounds. To promote greater gender equality, the Agency encourages applications in particular from women.

How to apply: See the vacancy notice on the European Commission's website for senior management post: https:// ec.europa.eu/dgs/human-resources/seniormanagementvacancies/

Closing date for applications: 9 December 2025, 12:00 noon Central European Time (CET)

For further details, visit ACER’s website: www.acer.europa.eu
